query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 La sete natural che mai non sazia 2 se non con l’acqua onde la femminetta 3 samaritana domandò la grazia,
4 mi travagliava, e pungeami la fretta 5 per la ’mpacciata via dietro al mio duca, 6 e condoleami a la giusta vendetta.
query.result:
**English:**
1 The natural thirst that is never quenched 2 except by the water for which the little Samaritan woman 3 asked as a favor,
4 tormented me, and the haste 5 along the difficult path behind my guide 6 urged me on, and I felt sympathy for the just vengeance.
**Cornish:**
1 An syth naturel na wra vythkweth byth 2 mar nyns yw gans an dowr dell yw an venen 3 Samaritan ow gorra gras,
4 ow tos ow troha, ha'n fretta 5 a-dreus dhe'n fordh lettys war-lergh ow thuek, 6 ha ow tos ow kevrohe orth an venjans just.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Ed ecco, sì come ne scrive Luca 8 che Cristo apparve a’ due ch’erano in via, 9 già surto fuor de la sepulcral buca,
10 ci apparve un’ombra, e dietro a noi venìa, 11 dal piè guardando la turba che giace; 12 né ci addemmo di lei, sì parlò pria,
13 dicendo: «O frati miei, Dio vi dea pace».
query.result:
**English:**
7 And behold, just as Luke writes 8 that Christ appeared to the two who were on the road, 9 already risen from the tomb,
10 a shade appeared to us, and it came behind us, 11 looking down at the crowd that lay at its feet; 12 and we did not ask about it, so it spoke first,
13 saying: "May God give you peace, my brothers."
**Cornish:**
7 Ha, wela, kepar hag y skrif Lucas 8 Crist ow tos ow hwel dhe'n dew o tos war an fordh, 9 ow tos ow sevel a-ves an bedh,
10 onen ow tos ow hwel dhe'n ni, ha ow tos ow tos war-lergh, 11 ow tos ow tos ow sel an bobel o tos ow tos ow kosha; 12 ha nyns ow tos ow gorra orth hemma, henna ow tos ow tos ow kewsel kyns,
13 ow tos ow leverel: "O'm brodher, Duw ow ro dhyn pes."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
14 Noi ci volgemmo sùbiti, e Virgilio 15 rendéli ’l cenno ch’a ciò si conface.
16 Poi cominciò: «Nel beato concilio 17 ti ponga in pace la verace corte 18 che me rilega ne l’etterno essilio».
query.result:
**English:**
14 We turned around suddenly, and Virgil 15 made the gesture that is appropriate for such a thing.
16 Then he began: "May the true court 17 place you in peace in the blessed council 18 that exiles me to eternal exile."
**Cornish:**
14 Ni a drohas war-tu, ha Virgili 15 a ro'n ar sin ow tos ow kov dhe'n fordh.
16 Wosa henna a leveris: "Yn an kunsel gwynvydh 17 an le a ro'n yn pes yn korf gwir 18 ow tos ow'm kas dhe'n esili erel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Come!», diss’ elli, e parte andavam forte: 20 «se voi siete ombre che Dio sù non degni, 21 chi v’ha per la sua scala tanto scorte?».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "Come!" he said, and we walked on quickly: 20 "If you are shades that God does not deem worthy of heaven, 21 who has escorted you so far up his ladder?"
**Cornish:**
19 "Dos!" a leveris, ha ni a mos war-tu bys: 20 "Mar why ow yw skevens na yw Duw ow tos ow kov dhe'n nef, 21 piw ow tos ow'n kas dhe'n fordh kemmys?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 E ’l dottor mio: «Se tu riguardi a’ segni 23 che questi porta e che l’angel profila, 24 ben vedrai che coi buon convien ch’e’ regni.
query.result:
**English:**
22 And my teacher: "If you look at the signs 23 that this one bears and that the angel outlined, 24 you will see clearly that he must reign with the good."
**Cornish:**
22 Ha'm doktor: "Mar t'y tos ow sel dhe'n sinow 23 ow tos an onen-ma ow tos an el a nota, 24 t'y gwels yn klear na wra dhe'n fordh gans an dhowr."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Ma perché lei che dì e notte fila 26 non li avea tratta ancora la conocchia 27 che Cloto impone a ciascuno e compila,
28 l’anima sua, ch’è tua e mia serocchia, 29 venendo sù, non potea venir sola, 30 però ch’al nostro modo non adocchia.
query.result:
**English:**
25 But because she who spins day and night 26 had not yet drawn out for him the distaff 27 that Clotho assigns and prepares for each person,
28 his soul, which is your sister and mine, 29 could not come up alone, 30 because it cannot see in our way.
**Cornish:**
25 Mes rag an onen-ma ow tos ow fila dydh ha nos 26 nyns esa ow tos ow tenna dhe'n gonokya 27 ow tos ow Cloto ow tos ow gorhemmyn ha ow tos ow kompila,
28 y eneval, ow tos ow'th serokya ha'm serokya, 29 ow tos ow tos war, nyns esa ow tos ow tos ow tos ow huni, 30 rag na wra dhe'n fordh ni ow tos ow tos ow gweles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Ond’ io fui tratto fuor de l’ampia gola 32 d’inferno per mostrarli, e mosterrolli 33 oltre, quanto ’l potrà menar mia scola.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Therefore I was drawn out of the wide maw 32 of Hell to show it to him, and I will show him 33 beyond, as far as my teaching can take him.
**Cornish:**
31 Dell owth ow tos ow tenna a-ves a'n gol lew 32 a'n ifern rag ow tos ow mos ow dhe'n, ha ow wra dhe'n mos dhe'n 33 owth, kemmys hag y'm skol a wra dhe'n kas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ma dimmi, se tu sai, perché tai crolli 35 diè dianzi ’l monte, e perché tutto ad una 36 parve gridare infino a’ suoi piè molli».
query.result:
**English:**
34 But tell me, if you know, why the mountain just now 35 collapsed, and why everything at once 36 seemed to cry out down to its soft foot».
**Cornish:**
34 Mes dywedh vy, mar esow, peraga'th'aga'n krolla 35 an menydh hemma, ha peraga pub tra veth 36 a welas galow bys dhe dhorn molli».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Sì mi diè, dimandando, per la cruna 38 del mio disio, che pur con la speranza 39 si fece la mia sete men digiuna.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Thus he spoke to me, satisfying, through the eye 38 of my desire, that thirst which with hope alone 39 had been made less ravenous.
**Cornish:**
37 Mar evel orth ytho, rag an kruna 38 a'ga dysyr, neb ow kul gans an spyrans 39 a wrug an syth vy dhegof.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Quei cominciò: «Cosa non è che sanza 41 ordine senta la religïone 42 de la montagna, o che sia fuor d’usanza.
query.result:
**English:**
40 He began: "There is nothing that does not 41 feel the religion of the mountain, without 42 order, or that is out of custom.
**Cornish:**
40 E commensis: "Nyns yw tra na vyns 41 a synj an relijyon a'n menydh, heb 42 urdh, po dhe ves dhe'n defowth kostom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Libero è qui da ogne alterazione: 44 di quel che ’l ciel da sé in sé riceve 45 esser ci puote, e non d’altro, cagione.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Here one is free from every alteration: 44 of that which heaven receives into itself from itself 45 there can be a cause, and of nothing else.
**Cornish:**
43 Rydh yw omma dhe bub alterasyon: 44 a'ga'ns yw an nef a-dhiworth y honan 45 a yll bos kawsys, ha nyns yw tra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Trema forse più giù poco o assai; 56 ma per vento che ’n terra si nasconda, 57 non so come, qua sù non tremò mai.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Perhaps a little or a lot lower down it trembles; 56 but because of wind that hides itself in the earth, 57 I do not know how, up here it never trembled.
**Cornish:**
55 Yth omma moy a-issel byghan po moy; 56 mes rag gwyns a wra'n tir a-ugh yn ayr, 57 ny wodhaf vy, omma na dhremis vy byth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Tremaci quando alcuna anima monda 59 sentesi, sì che surga o che si mova 60 per salir sù; e tal grido seconda.
query.result:
**English:**
58 It trembles when some pure soul 59 feels itself, so that it rises or moves 60 to climb up; and such a cry follows it.
**Cornish:**
58 Yth omma pan voel eneval enef 59 y honan, marow gwell po gorra 60 rag surmontya; ha galow henna a-ugh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 De la mondizia sol voler fa prova, 62 che, tutto libero a mutar convento, 63 l’alma sorprende, e di voler le giova.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Only the will makes trial of the filth, 62 which, completely free to change its dwelling, 63 surprises the soul and rejoices in its will.
**Cornish:**
61 An eyl a wra gwruthyl a'n monnans hepken, 62 neb, oll rydh rag chanjya unn tyller, 63 a wra'n gwyth an eneval, ha lowena y eyl.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Prima vuol ben, ma non lascia il talento 65 che divina giustizia, contra voglia, 66 come fu al peccar, pone al tormento.
query.result:
**English:**
64 At first it wills well, but the desire does not let it, 65 which divine justice, against its will, 66 as it was in sinning, condemns to torment.
**Cornish:**
64 Kyns, yth eyl da, mes nyns a let an talen 65 neb a wra'n gwirvos justith, yn erbyn y eyl, 66 dell ovel orth yn pehar, a wra'n gorrys orth an boen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 E io, che son giaciuto a questa doglia 68 cinquecent’ anni e più, pur mo sentii 69 libera volontà di miglior soglia:
70 però sentisti il tremoto e li pii 71 spiriti per lo monte render lode 72 a quel Segnor, che tosto sù li ’nvii».
query.result:
**English:**
67 And I, who have lain in this pain 68 five hundred years and more, only just now felt 69 the free will to a better threshold:
70 therefore you felt the trembling and the pious 71 spirits throughout the mountain rendering praise 72 to that Lord who soon sends them up».
**Cornish:**
67 Ha my, neb ow kovsys yn an angoans ma 68 pymp cans vledhen ha moy, pur hemma a-nysa 69 frank eyl orth unn tremenen well:
70 rag hemma a glewis an dhremis ha'n spyrys 71 fromm rag an menydh ow ro' dhankya 72 orth an Arloedh, neb a wra'n gorrys orth bys a-uch».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Così ne disse; e però ch’el si gode 74 tanto del ber quant’ è grande la sete, 75 non saprei dir quant’ el mi fece prode.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Thus he spoke; and because he enjoys 74 the good as much as the thirst is great, 75 I cannot say how much he benefited me.
**Cornish:**
73 Ythoma a leveris; hagen rag ev 74 kemmys an da yw an vrath yw an syth, 75 ny wodhvyn vyth pyth a wrug ev da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 E ’l savio duca: «Omai veggio la rete 77 che qui vi ’mpiglia e come si scalappia, 78 perché ci trema e di che congaudete.
query.result:
**English:**
76 And the wise leader: "Now I see the net 77 that ensnares you here and how it is escaped, 78 why you tremble and what you rejoice at.
**Cornish:**
76 Ha'n fur avysk: "Wrug vyth gweles an ros 77 a'th kep orth ama ha'gas a skap, 78 rag orth a dhregh ha'gas a gonhedhes."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Ora chi fosti, piacciati ch’io sappia, 80 e perché tanti secoli giaciuto 81 qui se’, ne le parole tue mi cappia».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Now who you were, may it please you that I know, 80 and why you have lain here for so many centuries, 81 tell me in your words.
**Cornish:**
79 Wrug vyth, pyth es, pyth voth vyth godhvos wyth vyth fios, 80 ha'gas kemmys oos oos o bledhynnyow 81 ama yma, dylloth vyth gerow vyth vyth lavarow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 «Nel tempo che ’l buon Tito, con l’aiuto 83 del sommo rege, vendicò le fóra 84 ond’ uscì ’l sangue per Giuda venduto,
85 col nome che più dura e più onora 86 era io di là», rispuose quello spirto, 87 «famoso assai, ma non con fede ancora.
query.result:
**English:**
82 "At the time when the good Titus, with the help 83 of the supreme king, avenged the wounds 84 from which the blood of Judas the betrayed flowed,
85 with the name that endures and honors most 86 I was there," replied that spirit, 87 "quite famous, but not yet with faith.
**Cornish:**
82 "Y'n termyn pan wrug an Titus da, gans skoes 83 an Myghtern Uhella, venjansya an wonnow 84 a lesas gans Judas an предатель,
85 gans an hanow a wra pella ha moyha 86 vy ogena," an spyrys a leveris, 87 "pur dha gelwys, mes nyns o fydh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Tanto fu dolce mio vocale spirto, 89 che, tolosano, a sé mi trasse Roma, 90 dove mertai le tempie ornar di mirto.
query.result:
**English:**
88 So sweet was my voice in song, 89 that, from Toulouse, Rome drew me to itself, 90 where I deserved to have my temples crowned with myrtle.
**Cornish:**
88 Kemmys o dowr o veu an spyrys vy, 89 ow tosolyan, Roma a'm gorra orth, 90 le mayth vyth templeow gans myrtel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Stazio la gente ancor di là mi noma: 92 cantai di Tebe, e poi del grande Achille; 93 ma caddi in via con la seconda soma.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Statius the people still call me there: 92 I sang of Thebes, and then of the great Achilles; 93 but I fell by the wayside with the second burden.
**Cornish:**
91 Stazius an bobel vyth a'm henwel yno: 92 kanas vyth a-dro dhe Thebai, ha wosa dhe'n Achilles meur; 93 mes vy a gwyllas orth an fordh gans an eyl orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E per esser vivuto di là quando 101 visse Virgilio, assentirei un sole 102 più che non deggio al mio uscir di bando».
query.result:
**English:**
100 And to have lived there when 101 Virgil lived, I would give up a sun 102 more than I ought to for my release from exile."
**Cornish:**
100 Ha dhe vewa bew dhe vewa yno pan 101 o veu Virgili ow byw, vy a leveraf 102 moy es onan sole es vyth dhefsa dhe'm gorra dhe'n esili."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Or son io d’una parte e d’altra preso: 116 l’una mi fa tacer, l’altra scongiura 117 ch’io dica; ond’ io sospiro, e sono inteso
118 dal mio maestro, e «Non aver paura», 119 mi dice, «di parlar; ma parla e digli 120 quel ch’e’ dimanda con cotanta cura».
query.result:
**English:**
115 Now I am seized on one side and the other: 116 one makes me keep silent, the other implores 117 that I speak; therefore I sigh, and I am heard
118 by my master, and he says to me, "Do not be afraid, 119 to speak; but speak and tell him 120 what he asks with such care."
**Cornish:**
115 Wellavowmeurynkeunndha'gankeunndro: 116 unnathmawravytagov,unnathmawravygolow 117 hennagowlavury,hagankeunndroynklavys
118 Genvernaguster,hagathmawravy, "Na'gasoweth", 119 "raglavury;meslavuryhagankeunndro 120 hennagowgovynnganskemmysgowgolon".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Ond’ io: «Forse che tu ti maravigli, 122 antico spirto, del rider ch’io fei; 123 ma più d’ammirazion vo’ che ti pigli.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Then I said: "Perhaps you marvel, 122 ancient spirit, at the laughter that I made; 123 but I want you to be even more amazed.
**Cornish:**
121 Genvernaguster: "Marowpythwhelas, 122 speryskoth,ragowlowhennavowrew; 123 mesmoryowkemmysgowgolonpythwhelas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Questi che guida in alto li occhi miei, 125 è quel Virgilio dal qual tu togliesti 126 forte a cantar de li uomini e d’i dèi.
query.result:
**English:**
124 This one who guides my eyes on high, 125 is that Virgil from whom you took 126 the power to sing of men and of gods.
**Cornish:**
124 Hennagowmawravyganowlagasowugh, 125 yw Virgili hennagowkemeras 126 galosekkantahaglowha'gandewlow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Se cagion altra al mio rider credesti, 128 lasciala per non vera, ed esser credi 129 quelle parole che di lui dicesti».
query.result:
**English:**
127 If you believed some other reason for my laughter, 128 abandon it as untrue, and believe those words 129 that you spoke about him to be true.
**Cornish:**
127 Marowpythwhelaskresonarallragowlowhennavowrew, 128 lehkavellraggenver,hagankeunndrogalos 129 hennagerowgowlavuryhagynnow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Già s’inchinava ad abbracciar li piedi 131 al mio dottor, ma el li disse: «Frate, 132 non far, ché tu se’ ombra e ombra vedi».
query.result:
**English:**
130 Already he was stooping to embrace the feet 131 of my teacher, but he said to him: "Brother, 132 do not do it, for you are a shade and you see a shade."
**Cornish:**
130 Wellavowkammalyasragowkollagasowtrager, 131 raguster,mesevadydh: "Breur, 132 na'wra,ragowowfloghhagankeunndroflogh".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Ed ei surgendo: «Or puoi la quantitate 134 comprender de l’amor ch’a te mi scalda, 135 quand’ io dismento nostra vanitate,
136 trattando l’ombre come cosa salda».
query.result:
**English:**
133 And he, rising, said: "Now you can understand the amount 134 of love that warms me towards you, 135 when I forget our vanity,
136 treating shades as if they were solid things."
**Cornish:**
133 Hagenawoseth: "Wellavowpythwhelaskemmysgowmeur, 134 karantegethkarantegamser, 135 panvowkollavynnowflogh,
136 owkollagasowfloghkemmysgowtrager".
